monogr.title: Philomythie or Philomythologie : wherin outlandish birds, beasts, and fishes, are taught to speake true English plainely By Tho: Scot Gent
monogr.author: Scot, Tho (Thomas)

keywords.term: Adages, aphorisms, emblem books, jests, proverbs

div.head: TO THE HONOVR of the illustrious Familie of the CECILLS, deseruing of this Commmonwealth, all the Romane wreaths of triumph: The memorable Pyramids of Egypt: And all other Trophes of Eternitie.
div.l: AS by one mouer, motion, doth commence,
Euen from the Center, to circumference:
So from one good Man, many may arise,
This now is verified; The Cecills are
Statesmen in time of p • ace, Souldiers in warre.
